alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 7:01PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Washington and south central Iron Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 701 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Zion National Park to 6 miles north of Washington to 13 miles west of Gunlock State Park. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zion National Park, St George, Washington, Hurricane, Santa Clara, La Verkin, New Harmony, Dameron Valley, Quail Creek State Park, Gunlock State Park, Ivins, Toquerville, Leeds, Kanarraville, Motoqua, Pintura, Pine Valley, Gunlock, Veyo and Snow Canyon State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 8 and 48. Utah Route 18 between mile markers 2 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Zion National Park
